attributes.action: Landlords should make a compulsory fee of £10 from rents to support homelessness
attributes.background: After seeing the incredible amount of homelessness within London and the obscene rental prices of houses, I want to see it become compulsory for landlords to give £10 out of London and £20 inner London per house to homelessness to fund better shelters / housing / general accomadation !
attributes.additional_details:
With London’s population of 8.6 million, 50% of these are in rental properties. The average house price being £743,000 it is no wonder landlords are cashing in on the ever growing need to rent. 
I truly believe that a small percentage of these rental fees would not be missed and would assist homelessness and make a considerable difference ! 
Please sign this petition to support this cause, Our children’s generation need this massive problem rectifying before it’s too late !!!

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to knowingly or recklessly mislead Parliament
attributes.background:
The operation of our democracy requires the electorate to be able to place trust in statements made by the Government and its ministers. 

Deception has no place in public life but is increasingly used as a means to an end.

Our Parliament must not become a post-truth institution.

attributes.action: Pay our community care workers per shift and not per client.
attributes.background: I've worked in the care industry for around 13 years now, 4 of which have being in community care. Care agencies have a quick turn over of staff this is mainly down to being under paid which in turn effects the quality of care provided to the vulnerable and a lack of continuity.
attributes.additional_details:
The care staff that take care of others loved ones the in the community are underpaid. Most care workers will cover a 15 hour day. They will be on the road back to back with calls and sometimes only get a short break yet will be working from 7:00 - 22:00 we are only paid client time this could be only 5 hours out off the whole 15hours worked 
Mileage is paid at 25p per mile yet travel time is not paid or paid if the adverage drops below the  NMW or paid a minimum of so many minutes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use parent-child spaces if you do not have a child with you
attributes.background: I would like parent-child spaces to be considered with the same respect as disabled spaces and be offered as a matter of course in all public car parks. As a mother of 2 infants I am left to struggle getting them out of the car in an unsafe space because people without a child use the child spaces.
attributes.additional_details: There is a safety issue as the extra space allowed in a child space means children can get in and out safely without being right next to the moving wheels of other vehicles. Additionally, these spaces are often closer to the trolley park or business entrance meaning if you have to get a special trolley to use or are carrying infants you don't have to go too far from the car in order to be able to do this safely. Having to carry children, baby bags and your shopping is very difficult already!

attributes.action: Make Sileby Train station more accessible.
attributes.background: Our community wants better access to Sileby train station so that wheelchair users, individuals who have mobility issues and individuals who have children in pushchairs. There are many steps going up to the platform. Therefore wheelchairs, pushchairs and those who cannot manage steps cannot access.

attributes.action: Make statutory adoption leave and pay available for the self employed
attributes.background: Statutory adoption pay and leave is not available to those who are self employed however statutory maternity leave and pay is.  This is discriminatory against those willing and wanting to give the best start to an adopted child by being at home to nurture, care and develop a bond with their child.
attributes.additional_details:
A self employed parent who can biologically have a child can receive statutory maternity leave and pay.  If for whatever reason they have chosen to adopt a child this self employed parent has no rights to adoption pay and leave.  

By leaving self employed adoptive parents to self fund and not work over this leave, it places another barrier to the adoption process.

A prospective adopter will have a strengthened application if they can show how one parent can commit to adoption leave.

attributes.action: add a vegan week in secondary school food tech curriculum
attributes.background: vegan food is often considered bland and boring, but by having a vegan week people will become more educated about veganism and will have a less negative opinion about it

attributes.action: Make pas43 a minimum legal requirement for all breakdown and recovery personnel
attributes.background: After working with various company’s doing roadside breakdowns and recovery, some of which apply pas43. The dangers of this are horrifying. I think it’s about time these guidelines were made legal as a minimum requirement to get rid of the cowboys and to reduce further risk to everyone
attributes.additional_details:
Where some company’s will use pas43 and stick to the guidelines, give staff the required training. There are still company’s out there that will send untrained staff in any vehicle to broken down vehicles which are ill equipped and have no extra reflectors or beacon. 
I have also have an email from a parliament case worker stating pas43 is not a legal requirement and is down to the company health and safety to make sure that staff know what they are doing at the roadside. This needs to change!

attributes.action: Add teaching of CPR and basic lifesaving skills to the teaching syllabus
attributes.background: Many lives could potentially be saved if more individuals within the U.K. knew how to correctly carry out CPR and had the knowledge of basic lifesaving skills. Include these topics in the primary & secondary national curriculum to save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance to councils on the eligibility for a disabled travel pass
attributes.background: People applying for a disabled persons pass are being asked for evidence of having had a drivers licence refused on medical grounds, even when they have never applied for a licence. This has happened to many people including myself and others with epilepsy and it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Transport Act 2000 says you are eligible if you would be refused a driving licence due to physical fitness, IF you ever applied. The practice of demanding a refusal letter is therefore not correct, as the law does not say you have to have applied for a licence. 

Some authorities now accept a doctor’s letter, but a person has to get this by appointment with a specialist, which can cost up to £200. Clear and legally binding guidance must be issued to all local authorities so that they understand what the law actually says and stop denying disabled people what they are legally entitled to.

attributes.action: Reverse the cuts made to police services across the UK since 2010 to save lives!
attributes.background: We call on the government to reverse cuts made to all UK police services since 2010, give our police officers a proper pay rise, and save our officers' pensions! This has gone on for too long and we want the government to support, equip, and fund our police properly so they can protect us properly!
attributes.additional_details:
The latest statistics show a 14% year-on-year increase in criminal offences recorded by forces across England and Wales. 

Knife crime has gone up by 21%.
 
Gun crime has risen by 20%.

Domestic burglary has risen by 32%.

Vehicle-related crimes have increased by 18%.

The murder and manslaughter rate in England and Wales has risen to the highest in a decade.

When will the PM and Home Secretary act? They have Special Branch protection so they'll never be victims of crimes. What about us?!

attributes.action: Require restaurant food to be labelled with carbohydrate content for diabetics
attributes.background: As a type 1 diabetic I find it extremely hard to work out exactly how much insulin I need to inject when eating fast food. Guessing my insulin means I may under or over inject insulin which has a huge affect on my glucose levels.
attributes.additional_details:
Unstable glucose levels can have a huge effect on diabetics.
 
The NHS spend over £1.5m an hour on diabetes or 10% of the NHS budget. 
https://www.diabetes.co.uk/cost-of-diabetes.html
 
1 in 16 people have diabetes in the UK which is over 4 million! 
 
It’s a condition that is on the rise which impacts lives. 
 
Severe Complications can occur from poor control - Heart, liver, kidney, eye and circulation problems are just a few.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Ensure cyber bullying attacks both real person and fake accounts are investigated by the police and persons dealt with accordingly. Cyber bullying makes our young people and adults twice as likely to self harm. We are seeing people taking their own life because of this. Police are not preventing.

attributes.action: Be commited to holding a second referendum on Scottish independence after Brexit
attributes.background: I am asking the UK government to be committed to holding a second referendum on Scottish Independence, because it looks like we are heading towards a hard Brexit, which could damaging to the UK and Scottish economies in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
And also here is a list of things she plans to and/or could do do to Scotland:

- take Scotland out of the EU against its will, despite voting overwhelmingly to remain. 
- remove powers from the Scottish Parliament after Brexit. 
- they could close down the parliament and rip up the devolution settlement. 
- wipe out the SNP and other parties completely for good in Scotland. 
- sell Scotland down the river.
The prime minister must regard this as a ‘power grab’ if this is likely to happen.

attributes.action: Ask Esther McVey to make a further statement to Parliament
attributes.background: Esther McVey's apology over her misrepresentation of the National Audit Office's report into Universal Credit does not stand up to scrutiny. She needs to further explain how she came to be using words that were the polar opposite to the report.

attributes.action: Re-think the current legislation criminalising cannabis.
attributes.background: The governments response to a similar petition stated that they are basing policy on a 10 year old report done under labour, I'm asking the government to re-think this policy by conducting a new, up to date and relevant study to bring our legislation up to modern standards.

attributes.action: ‘Palm oil’ to be clearly labelled on products containing it, to help consumers.
attributes.background: There are many names for palm oil that consumers won’t recognise. It is not as clear as looking at the ingredients list on a product and searching for palm oil. Some ingredients may be from palm oil but it will not be labelled, e.g. ‘vegetable oil’ in a product may or may not be from palm oil.
attributes.additional_details:
Some names for ingredients that could or do contain palm oil:
INGREDIENTS: Vegetable Oil, Vegetable Fat, Palm Kernel, Palm Kernel Oil, Palm Fruit Oil, Palmate, Palmitate, Palmolein, Glyceryl, Stearate, Stearic Acid, Elaeis Guineensis, Palmitic Acid, Palm Stearine, Palmitoyl Oxostearamide, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-3, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Sodium Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Kernelate, Sodium Palm Kernelate, Sodium Lauryl Lactylate/Sulphate, Hyrated Palm Glycerides, Etyl Palmitate, Octyl Palmitate, Palmityl Alcohol

CONTAINS: Palm oil

attributes.action: Allow Pubs/Clubs to have their own policy on tobacco consumption
attributes.background: The blanket ban on smoking in pubs and clubs is illiberal in a society that time and time again calls itself as a free one. There should be a removal of smoking bans in pubs, and the proprietors/owners themselves should be allowed to set their own policies for their own property.
attributes.additional_details: A society that values private property, freedom of choice and enterprise cannot simply impose a blanket ban, such as the ban on smoking in Pubs. This petition is designed to allow parliament to debate the effectiveness of each landlord being able to declare their pub as smoking/non-smoking as they see fit, with the same consequences and restrictions for those who smoke in non-smoking pubs as exist today.

attributes.action: Put a Childcare Levy in place to help working families with childcare costs.
attributes.background: The majority of the existing childcare support options are income based and do not incentivise women to go back to work.  To claim and access childcare support is difficult. Even though the government spends £7.5n in childcare support per year, it only covers a fraction of families’ childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: We need a well-rounded childcare infrastructure that helps working families with childcare costs and incentive women to go back to work. We need the government to incentivise companies to offer childcare arrangements as part of their benefits umbrella. We need a Childcare Levy to cover childcare costs of working parents for children up to the age of 5. We need a register of childcarers so that parents can leave their children in safe hands. www.childcarelevy.co.uk

attributes.action: Ensure costs for restoring order at HMP Birmingham are met by G4S not taxpayers
attributes.background: In 2011, the running of HM Prison Birmingham was entrusted to outsourcing company G4S. As G4S has failed in its responsibilities, the government should ensure that any costs associated with restoring appropriate conditions at the prison are met by the company and not by the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The company’s failure to maintain order and provide a safe, habitable environment that will ensure the rehabilitation of inmates, and their return to society has been reported by HM Inspectorate of Prisons www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk and the prison has now been placed under the control of the Ministry of Justice. 
 
As G4S has been found to have failed in its duty of care to the inmates and staff alike, the Government should take all possible steps to ensure the taxpayer is not penalised for the company’s failure to meet its contractual obligations.

attributes.action: Fund more services to Walsall by looking at reopening old lines and stations.
attributes.background: I am writing to please ask the government to look into reopening the old lines around Walsall like the Sutton Park Line, South Staffordshire Line, Walsall-Wolverhampton Line and to please add services to Wellington, Stafford, Shropshire, Wolverhampton (Direct) and to other places in England.

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship after 8 years of marriage to a British Citizen
attributes.background: There have been cases of British citizens being blackmailed, bullied and forced into marriage to obtain British Citizenship. Stronger laws should be placed to stop sham marriages.
attributes.additional_details: British citizenship should only be granted to foreign nationals after 8 years of being together. A temporary British passport can be granted however, the temporary British passport could be terminated if separation takes place before 8 years.

attributes.action: Stop the manufacture and importation of non biodegradable plastics
attributes.background: Our planet is choking on non bio degradable plastics. We need to act NOW and immediately stop the manufacture and importation of these life threatening products.

attributes.action: Make EV charging as easy as filling up with petrol/diesel fuel.
attributes.background: Make all charging stations accept credit or debit cards or maybe cash with no prior membership. The cost per kWh should also be displayed in the same way as fuel prices are displayed on forecourts. EV uptake will be significantly improved if owners know they can easily charge anywhere.
attributes.additional_details: To charge an EV currently requires one to be a member of a variety of different clubs with different schemes and maybe club cards in order to access charging power points. I usually charge at home but recently tried charging at a charging point but failed. I had installed Polar instants on my phone with credit but either I didn't have mobile data access or the polar servers weren't working but I was unsuccessful. Fortunately I just had enough charge to limp home.

attributes.action: Temporary blue badges to be available for those who are incapacitated short term
attributes.background: In 2016 I had foot surgery, I was in plaster cast, followed by a surgical boot. During this time when I was taken to the shops, I was actually more incapacitated than a lot of those who were able to use the disabled parking spaces.
attributes.additional_details: I have contacted West Sussex County Council and my MP in relation to this matter to be told basically that the Blue Badge legislation only currently allows badges to be issued to people with permanent conditions and has a severe impact on their ability to walk and funding.

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: Urge Japan to criminalise hunting, slaughter & sale of dolphins into captivity
attributes.background: In Taiji hunters drive pods of dolphins with banger/speed boats & nets into the cove for sale into captivity, slaughter or release. The drive is brutal, captivity of wild dolphins is cruel, slaughter in front of their family is devastating & release is heartbreaking for young who lost family members
attributes.additional_details: http://www.wowvstaiji.com/

attributes.action: Change the threshold for higher rate tax to at least £60,000.
attributes.background: A person earning up to £46,350 pays basic rate tax (20%). After that the tax increases to 40% for anyone earning between £46,351 and £150,000. I feel it is unfair that a person earning £43,351 per annum should be on the same rate of tax as someone earning more than three times the salary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/income-tax-rates

attributes.action: Change the Family Law to protect non-resident parents and make contact easy.
attributes.background:
There are parents who have their kids full time, that use the kids as weapons against their ex partners, refusing contact or extra contact to the children, if certain demands are not adhered to. 
This in turn is causing suicide, mental illness, physical illness, and financial hardship.
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be a signed agreement when parents split detailing the days that the non-resident parent can see the kids. This should be done at the local council and be a document that is recognised by the court of law as a binding contract. In addition: 
• CSA should be overhauled to take into account not just the non-resident’s income, but their cost of living. 
• The 48 hour fortnight law should be changed to 53 hours, giving the leaving parent a chance to see their kids after school. An extra one day in a week during school half term should also be introduced.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for there to be CCTV in special and PRU schools
attributes.background: Special needs schools and PRU settings often need to use restraint procedures on children to ensure the safety of children and staff. During a restraint, my son has sustained 16 injuries on his face, neck, arms, legs, chest, abdomen and back. CCTV would ensure that incidents can be investigated.
attributes.additional_details: If schools had CCTV there would be no question about these events. Staff and parents could watch the events unfold and staff can be held to account if needed, or shown to be using resonable force if they were. It is important that there is an unbiased view of the events as when a child needs restraining, emotions run high, as often staff can get hurt. CCTV would show what happened and why and mean that it is easy and transparent to investigate.

attributes.action: Require a child train fare to be ages 5-16 whilst in full time education
attributes.background: Rail companies define child fares as from age 5-15. But a 16 year old can still be at school (Year 11) and has to pay an adult fare.
attributes.additional_details: Companies cite the young person railcard however this cannot be used for morning fares, season tickets or fares under a certain cost. Student discounts aren't available until Year 12. This means that in their most important year 16 year old children and their family are facing the stress of paying double the amount. http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/times_fares/46494.aspx

attributes.action: Make abusers pay financial costs for forced marriage and honour abuse victims
attributes.background: When victims are abroad unfortunately to be rescued those victims over the age of 18 end up in thousands of debt to the Home Office before they start their new life! Home office help the victims but unfortunately victims have to repay their travel costs etc. Abusers should be billed not victims.
attributes.additional_details: As a victim of honour abuse and walking away at the age of 30 it came with a huge financial burden that was hard to cope with! Victims deal with more than enough like social isolation, mental health, live in hiding due to their safety etc.

attributes.action: Increase the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p across the UK
attributes.background: It takes up to 1000 years for a plastic bag to decompose in landfills. Over 100 million marine animals die each year due to plastic in the oceans and other water systems. The 5p bag charge reduced plastic bag usuage by 85% but 2.1 billion bags were still sold between April 2016 and April 2017.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for MPs & immediate family to own shares in weapon manufacturers
attributes.background: If an MP has a personal interest in share prices increasing for weapon manufacture companies, they cannot be considered to be truly impartial when creating policy surrounding weapon sales to countries with poor human rights records.

attributes.action: Require shops to give workers Boxing Day, New Year’s Day and Easter Sunday off.
attributes.background: It’s so unfair. Whilst area managers, company owners and office staff stay home with their families retail workers HAVE to work! We need time at home with our families too. Where I live there is no public transport on Boxing Day so I’m expected to walk the 4 miles to work and back!!

attributes.action: Make self defence part of the physical education curriculum
attributes.background: With more and more assaults and the increase of knife crime, I think it should be mandatory that schools teach their students self defence.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017, there were just under 39,600 recorded offences involving the use of a knife or sharp instrument in England and Wales. That’s the highest level recorded over a year since comparable figures began in 2011.

attributes.action: Debate the government's adoption of the IHRA definition in its entirety.
attributes.background: The UK government to debate their decision to accept the IHRA definition of antisemitism in its entirety based on the observations of learned counsel & others that it is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Some people consider that the IHRA definition and the examples are poorly drafted, misleading, and could lead to the suppression of legitimate debate and freedom of expression.

attributes.action: Prevent persons on the sex offenders register from running a licensed premises
attributes.background:
There are numerous licences premises being run leased and occupied by convicted sex offenders in this country. 
I have been told that this is within the law. 
In my opinion and many others this should not be allowed.

attributes.action: There should be mental health professionals available to go out to emergencies.
attributes.background: I have struggled with my mental health for many years and believe that there should be mental health professionals available to attend emergency situations that may be mental health related such as attempted suicide and self harm.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health is a growing problem and can affect anyone and everyone. We need the rift support in place to support those in need of mental health help.

attributes.action:
Refuse to uphold the NI (Executive Formation and
Exercise of Functions) Bill.
attributes.background: This Bill will compromise democracy in NI, placing decision-making in the hands of unelected civil servants and retrospectively blocking challenges to the Secretary of State's requirement to call an election within a reasonable period of time, an important safeguard to our democratic institutions.
attributes.additional_details: Our government may be currently at a stalemate, but Parliament has no mandate from the people of Northern Ireland to revoke our democratic rights and their safeguards.

attributes.action: A 2nd Brexit referendum should allow 17 year olds on electoral registers to vote
attributes.background: Brexit will affect the UK for generations to come, and in particular the future of our young people.  As with the referendum on Scottish Independence, it is only right therefore that more of them should be given a say.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally such a vote should be extended to all eligible 16 and 17 year olds in the UK, but I recognise that there is unlikely to be enough time to enact this before a second Brexit Referendum, if there is one.  However, electoral rolls should already include the names of 17 year old household occupants.

attributes.action: Regulate the transfer of terminally people ill from home to palliative care.
attributes.background: Transfers from home to palliative care usually involve a number of public and commercial services, each following their own safeguarding procedures. However, if serious omissions are to be avoided there is a pressing need for a mechanism which locks these different safeguarding procedures together.
attributes.additional_details:
A central Government initiative, in the form of national protocol or code of practice, would help to ensure that certain standards are achieved by all those involved in transferring the terminally ill from home to palliative care.

Any central Government protocol or code of practice would need to be embedded in the various safeguarding procedures and this should lead to improved collaboration, better communication and a more collaborative way of working for all those involved.

attributes.action: Lower the tax on alcohol sold in pubs and clubs
attributes.background: Once the local pub or club was the centre of a community, people met their future spouses, discussed their problems and received help, made friends and built a network of support encouraging a communal spirit and mental well-being. Cheap alcohol consumption from an off licence fosters non of this.
attributes.additional_details: There is a rising level of mental health issues / youth disorders I believe can be linked to the lose of community spirit. Clubs and pubs can form a focal point of this along side health and fitness centers, recreational clubs and community centers.  The tax on alcohol should be lowered in pubs / clubs to encourage people to get out and socialize rather than consume alcohol at home from off licence premises.

attributes.action: Create a new permanent national UK bank holiday: "Bank holiday of Pride."
attributes.background: 2017 marked 50 year anniversary for decriminalization of homosexuality- all we got were apologies (some posthumously).
attributes.additional_details: 2018 marked 30 years since Section 28 Education clause was removed-again apology but couched with "it was protecting children". Now there are debates about trans issues and the Gender Recognition Act.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of coyote fur
attributes.background: Coyotes are made to suffer for days awaiting to be killed for the use of their fur on coats! A store in Regent street opened with protests but it is still on going! Companies should use faux fur. Protect animals!

attributes.action: Raise awareness about a newly found Genetic Condition EBF3-HADDS
attributes.background:
I am starting this online petition for the UK government to Raise more awareness about this newly found Genetic Condition syndrome called EBF3-HADDS.
This rare mutations in the gene has just recently been found so very little is know. About it. Help us raise more awareness about it please.
attributes.additional_details: https://ebf3blog.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Revoke Section 74 of the LLA Act 2007 that permits the reuse of graves
attributes.background: Section 74 of the London Local Authorities Act 2007 permits a burial authority to disturb human remains for the purposes of re-using the graves, but Cemeteries are failing to locate people who may have an inherited right. The current procedure is not adequate to identify potential owners of graves.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Government to develop new legislation in this field to ensure re-use of graves is only permitted where permission from the grave owner or their relatives, as defined by the regulation, is given.

Graves and memorials provide a tangible link to our past, assist genealogical research but primarily form part of our heritage and encourage acts of Respect and Remembrance, but they are currently being abused.

attributes.action: Make hate speech against disabled people a criminal offence.
attributes.background: "Disableism" and discrimination based on your physical or cognitive ability has long been both unacceptable socially and legislatively. However, verbal abuse is often the start of such discrimination and has for too long been left as "colloquial" or dismissed as "slang" . It is time for this to end
attributes.additional_details: Children and young people who have additional needs are more likely to end up in a youth offending programme, less likely to have their mental health needs taken seriously and more likely to be lower earners. Our society disadvantages those with any form of disability in subtle ways. Verbal abuse, the use of words that are as insulting to disabled people as the worst racist abuse, are demonstrative of underlying social acceptance of this discrimination. We need to take a stand, make this not just socially unacceptable but criminal.

attributes.action: Ban the use of unsustainable palm oil in products sold within the UK
attributes.background: As we are all aware, the exploitation of natural rain-forests is prominent in the production of palm oil. The rainforests of Borneo are thought to be up to 130 million years old and provide a home for around 1,200 animals, of which 100 are endemic.
attributes.additional_details: There is a lot being done by local charities and conservationists but there is little help when multinational corporations can afford to do almost anything they like. We, as British Citizens, must do more to affect the demand for products containing palm oil and stop the degredation of these rainforests. In an ever-conscious world, there is no excuse to be making decisions that affect our planet in such a catastrophic way. We are the cause and we can be solution.

attributes.action: Make any form of bullying a punishable criminal offence
attributes.background:
As my son is suffering continued bullying and nothing being done . 
And to stop other children being bullied.
